是个好问题，我觉得有必要让大陆之外的华人普及一些中共的常识，但这个话题太大了，中共本身是黑箱系统，下面的人不知道上面怎么运作的。

王绍光有个课程 Government and Politics in China可以看看
http://www.cuhk.edu.hk/gpa/wang_files/

王绍光虽然是个红色学者跟胡鞍钢发表吹捧论文，但是这个课程我觉得还不错。大陆之外的华人看看这些红色学者也能了解红色思维方式。

建议读课程大纲里列出的论文即可，没必要听他讲课。阅读材料包 http://www.cuhk.edu.hk/gpa/wang_files/1070-2015.rar

Government and Politics of China
(GPAD 1070/UGEC 1540)
Shaoguang Wang
Spring 2015    Tel. 3943-7515   wangshaoguang@ cuhk.edu.hk
Office Hour:    Wednesday & Thursday: 10:30-12:00
TA:   Mattias OTTERVIK  ottervik@cuhk. edu.hk

Course Description
This is an introductory course that surveys key issues in Chinese politics: Why was there a Communist revolution? Does Mao deserve the credit - or blame - for his accomplishments and failures? After his death, why and how did the Chinese Communist Party (CCP) embrace market-oriented reform and open-door policy? How did the CCP manage to survive the mass extinction of Communist regimes after 1989? What kind of political regime is China evolving into? Although the emphasis is on learning Chinese perspectives on Chinese problems, all of these issues will be examined in historical and comparative perspective.

Reading
◼ All the readings are available from my WebPages at:
http://www.cuhk.edu.hk/gpa/wang_files  
◼ For a list of books on China, please download it from the following site:
http://www.princeton.edu/~lynn/chinabib.pdf
◼ Maurice Meisner, “The Significance of the Chinese Revolution in World History”

分主题读下面这些文章即可
1. Introduction
Perry Anderson, Two Revolutions or 佩里·安德森： “两场革命”http://info.whb.cn/xxld/view/12229
2. Watch video “China Rising”
(“Paradise of adventures” and “Change in heaven”)
3. The Rise of Modern China
Robert E. Bedeski, “The Evolution of the Modern State in China” 
4. Mao’s China and After
◼ 杜赞奇(Prasenjit Duara),“从历史和比较的观点看中国改革”
◼ 郭益耀，“不可忘记毛泽东”
5. The State and Economy
◼ Chris Bramall, “Origins of the Agricultural ‘Miracle’: Some Evidence from Sichuan”
◼ 史正富，《超 常 增 长：1979-2049年的中国经济》节选
6. The State and Society
◼ 李毅：“当今中国社会各阶级阶层的分析”
◼ OECD, “Inequality: Recent Trends in China and Experience in the OECD Area”
7. Mid-Term Essay Writing
8. The Formal Structure of the Political System: The Party
◼ 强世功，“中国宪法中的不成文宪法：理解中国宪法的新视角”
◼ Larry Catá Backer, “Towards a Robust Theory of the Chinese Constitutional State: Between Formalism and Legitimacy in Jiang Shigong's Constitutionalism”
9. The Formal Structure of the Political System: The State
◼ 何艳玲，“中国国务院（政务院）机构变迁逻辑”
◼ John P. Burns and Wang Xiaoqi, “Civil Service Reform in China: Impacts on Civil Servants Behaviour
10. Policy-Making
◼ Sebastian Heilmann, Policy Experimentation in China's Economic Rise
◼ Shaoguang Wang, Changing Models of Chinas Policy Agenda Setting
11. Central-Local Relations
⚫ Dong Lisheng, Central Local Relations in China: Retrospect and Prospect
⚫ 苏力，“当代中国的中央与地方分权”
12. Participation and Election
⚫ Yusheng Yao, “Village Elections and Their Impact: An Investigative Report on a Northern Chinese Village”
⚫ Jie Lu, “Varieties of Electoral Institutions in China's Grassroots Democracy: Cross Sectional and Longitudinal Evidence from Rural China
13. Political Culture
⚫ Elizabeth J. Perry, Chinese Conceptions of Rights: From Mencius to Maoand Now
⚫ H. Christoph Steinhardt, How is High Trust in China Possible? Comparing the Origins of Generalized Trust in Three Chinese Societies
14. Conclusion
⚫ Bai Gao, The Rubiks Cube State: A Reconceptualization of Political Change in Contemporary China
⚫ Brooke A. Ackerly, Is Liberalism the Only Way toward Democracy? Confucianism and Democracy
